title: Good bye!
historical_context: This article reflects the personal experiences of a prominent figure in the virus writing community during the late 1990s, a time when the hacker culture was evolving and gaining more visibility.
target_audience: Hackers, virus writers, security professionals, and those interested in hacker culture history.
short_summary: Mister Sandman reflects on his departure from the virus writing group 29A, explaining the personal reasons behind his decision and expressing pride in the group's achievements. He shares his future plans as an independent virus writer.
summary: Mister Sandman fondly recalls his time with 29A, a group he co-founded, and reflects on the growth and success they achieved together. He acknowledges the friendships formed within the virus writing community as the most rewarding aspect of his journey. As he transitions to an independent role, he remains supportive of 29A's ongoing work and expresses gratitude for the experiences that shaped his career in the virus scene. His message resonates with a sense of nostalgia and hope for the future, highlighting the personal connections that underpin the hacker culture.
